results.title: Journey to Antarctica
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Frank Bagnall, Maslyn Williams, Lee Robinson and Philip Law
results.brief_description: Records a trip to Antarctica with a typical Australian National Antarctic Research Expedition. Phillip Law tells of the work done by the 70 men who man the four Australian stations. Shows the erection of an automatic weather station; reconnaisance; the daily routine of the scientists at the stations; and follows a surveying exploratory party using tractor trains and supported by aircraft.

results.title: Journey Through the Bible Lands
results.brief_description: Watch the Bible come to life in this video tour of the Holy Land. Begin your visit at the Red Sea, following the path of Moses and the Israelites through the desert of Sinai. Continue into the Negev, past the ancient walls of Hebron, to Bethlehem, where Jesus was born. Walk through the crowded streets of Nazareth and along the shores of the Sea of Galilee. Visit Masada, the mountaintop fortress, then take the ancient road through Sumeria. Pass Jericho and the Red Sea before entering Jerusalem, Israel’s capital and holy city to three faiths.

results.brief_description: Animated figures in a dream sequence introduce food nutrients, their function and their source. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Journey through Japan
results.creator_credit: Shibui Films and Japan. National Tourist Organisation
results.brief_description: The kinship between humans and nature is shown in this film designed to inform on all aspects of Japanese life and the countryside during the four seasons of the year. We see the modern industrial Japan and the ancient traditional ways which are still evident in ceremonies, festivals, arts and crafts, buildings and rural areas.

results.title: Journey through Britain
results.creator_credit: Associated British-Pathe, BOAC, Terry Ashwood and Frederic Goode
results.brief_description: A film tour of England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland. A panorama of countryside, villages and castles is seen side-by-side with the modern amenities which these islands also offer. The film concludes with a section of the attractions of London.

results.title: Journey of hope = Reise der Hoffnung = Umud'a yolculuk
results.creator_credit: Condor Features, Catpics, Alfi Sinniger and Xavier Koller
results.brief_description: The true story of a Turkish couples’s flight, with their young son, from the abject poverty and hardship of their mountain village in Turkey to the land of unimagined riches - Switzerland. Selling everything they have in the world to pay for their illegal passage, and leaving the rest of their children with relatives, the three unworldly travellers begin their journey. After initially being refused entry at the border, they and other refugees like them fall prey to a group of smugglers, who direct them to access Switzerland via an illegal and dangerous mountain pass. Despite murderous weather they are sent on their way, alone, their guides unwilling to brave the perils of the journey. Acted, photographed and edited with impeccable restraint, this is a haunting, dignified and inspiring film. Cast includes: Necmettin Cobanoglu, Nur Surer and Emin Sivas. In German and Turkish with English subtitles. Winner of Academy Award for Best Foreign Film 1990 and Golden Leopard Award, Locarno Film Festival.

results.title: Journey of Fabio Pacchioni
results.creator_credit: United Nations Television, Unesco, Ben Park and Sidney Reichman
results.brief_description: The Italian theatre director, Fabio Pacchioni, was sent to Ecuador by UNESCO to establish a national theatre. Shows his activities, not only in recruiting and training a corps of actors, but also in projecting his own belief in the social responsibility of the theatre. The company toured remote villages and became acquainted with the people.

results.title: Journey of a lifetime
results.creator_credit: Senior Films, Penn Overland Tours and David Bilcock
results.brief_description: A journey by coach from England to Bombay in India, highlighting the Asian and Middle Eastern countries. Byblos, the oldest city in the world, Instanbul where East and West have mingled throughout history; the exotic Blue Mosque; Damascus so eastern in atmosphere; historic Jerusalem; the majesty of the Khyber Pass; Lahore, steeped in British colonialism; and the splendour of the Taj mahal, are a few of the fascinating places visited.

results.title: Journey north
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film, Television and Laboratories and Ted Wilson
results.brief_description: A road journey fromn Port Augusta to Alice Springs. Shows industrial development at Port Augusta; the beauty and vastness of the inland from the Flinders Ranges through Pimba and the saltbush country; wildflowers that spring up after rain; some of the station properties; opal mining at Coober Pedy; Gibber plains; the remains of bush fires; cattle droving; salt pans and dry creek beds and finally the town of Alice Springs.

results.title: Journey into time
results.brief_description: Presents an animated overview of the earth’s five great geological eras. Depicts one theory of the earth’s origin, its primeval state, transformation from a fiery ball to an inhabitable globe, and the predominant forms of life throughout geological time. Narrated by Gilbert Mack. Suitable for secondary level.
